author: ryanleeschneider
content: Yes but I’d still prefer to cleanly remove our validator versus just shutting it (and our bootnode) down since I’m not sure if people are still using it.

author: ryanleeschneider
content: All the recent blocks have txs in them so someone is still using it for something.

author: peter.davies
content: Rinkeby is deprecated, but it's not scheduled for shutdown until Q2/Q3 of 2023. See https://blog.ethereum.org/2022/06/21/testnet-deprecation.

author: ryanleeschneider
content:
FWIW it looks like two of the seven rinkeby validators are offline:

https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/address/0xb279182d99e65703f0076e4812653aab85fca0f0#mine <-- offline almost a year
https://rinkeby.etherscan.io/address/0xf10326c1c6884b094e03d616cc8c7b920e3f73e0#mine <-- offline a week

If we shutdown as well that'd leave the network at 4/7, which should progress but is cutting things close, so it still seems like a good idea to `clique_propose` removing us (and the two above if they cannot be contacted).
